answers.answer: Hi,Considering the time that has lapsed and also the factors to be considered as one ages(presence of associated diseases like diabetes and hypertension, the decrease in sexual responses that comes with age, certain medications) the previous surgery may not play a direct role regarding the cause of your present symptoms considering also that you never had any problems with sexual functions post surgery until now. However, a complete physical assessment with your primary physician will be able to help.Do you have erectile problems greater than 25% of the time? Do you get erections at night? Your physician may be able to help differentiate on whether this is caused by an underlying physical or psychological problem.Do keep us posted for anything.

question: I am 57 years old, had a herina operation in my 20's. Now experiencing problems with retainung an erection and reaching climax. Is this related? HELP
title: dysfunction
